revised_title: Measurement of High Refrangibility Rays' Wavelengths in Elementary Substances Spectra
tldr: The authors describe a method of measuring the wavelengths of high refrangibility rays in the spectra of elementary substances using a small Rutherfurd speculum and a microscope. They accurately measured the spectra and calculated the wave-lengths of the lines, comparing them with previous measurements. The study includes 2307 lines from various elements, with a series of eighteen enlarged photographs presented alongside the paper.
